title: Introduction

body.body: Two balancer shafts are fitted to the engine, one in front of the crankshaft in the upper crankcase and one behind it in the lower crankcase. Each balancer has the effect of a pair of counterbalance weights, which create an equal amount of energy in the opposite direction, and at the same time as that produced by the crankshaft, pistons and connecting rods. Because the opposing pulses occur at the same point of crankshaft rotation, and are of an equal magnitude, a state of equilibrium or balance is reached.
